==Events==
*[[1508]] &ndash; [[Maximilian I, Holy Roman Emperor]], is defeated in [[Friuli]] by [[Republic of Venice|Venetian]] troops
*[[1513]] &ndash; [[Italian Wars]]: [[Battle of Novara (1513)|Battle of Novara]]. [[Switzerland|Swiss]] troops defeat the French under [[Louis de la Tremoille]], forcing the French to abandon [[Milan]]. Duke [[Massimiliano Sforza]] is restored.
*[[1523]] &ndash; [[Gustav Vasa]], the Swedish regent, is elected [[Monarchy of Sweden|King of Sweden]], marking a symbolic end to the [[Kalmar Union]]. This is the Swedish national day.
*[[1586]] &ndash; [[Francis Drake]]'s forces raid [[St. Augustine, Florida|St. Augustine]] in [[Spanish Florida]].
*[[1644]] &ndash; The [[Qing dynasty]] [[Manchu people|Manchu]] forces led by the [[Shunzhi Emperor]] capture Beijing during the collapse of the [[Ming dynasty]]. 
*[[1654]] &ndash; [[Christina of Sweden|Queen Christina]] abdicates the Swedish throne and is succeeded by her cousin [[Charles X Gustav of Sweden|Charles X Gustav]].
*[[1674]] &ndash; [[Shivaji]], founder of the [[Maratha Empire]], is crowned.
*[[1683]] &ndash; The [[Ashmolean Museum]] in [[Oxford]], England, opens as the world's first university museum.
*[[1752]] &ndash; A devastating fire destroys one-third of Moscow, including 18,000 homes.
*[[1762]] &ndash; British forces begin a siege of [[Havana]] and temporarily capture the city in the [[Battle of Havana (1762)|Battle of Havana]]. 
*[[1808]] &ndash; [[Napoleon]]'s brother, [[Joseph Bonaparte]], is crowned [[Monarchy of Spain|King of Spain]].
*[[1809]] &ndash; Sweden promulgates a new [[Instrument of Government (1809)|Constitution]], which restores political power to the [[Riksdag of the Estates]] after 20 years of [[enlightened absolutism]]. At the same time, [[Charles XIII of Sweden|Charles XIII]] is elected to succeed [[Gustav IV Adolf of Sweden|Gustav IV Adolf]] as [[Monarchy of Sweden|King of Sweden]].
*[[1813]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: [[Battle of Stoney Creek]] &ndash; A British force of 700 under [[John Vincent (general)|John Vincent]] defeats an American force twice its size under [[William H. Winder|William Winder]] and [[John Chandler]].
*[[1822]] &ndash; [[Alexis St. Martin]] is accidentally shot in the stomach, leading to [[William Beaumont]]'s studies on digestion.
*[[1832]] &ndash; The [[June Rebellion]] in Paris is put down by the National Guard.
*[[1833]] &ndash; [[Andrew Jackson]] becomes the first [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] to ride on a train.
*[[1844]] &ndash; The [[YMCA|Young Men's Christian Association]] (YMCA) is founded in London.
*[[1857]] &ndash; [[Sophia of Nassau]] marries the future King [[Oscar II of Sweden|Oscar II]] of [[Sweden–Norway]].
*[[1859]] &ndash; Australia: Queensland is established as a separate [[crown colony|colony]] from [[New South Wales]] ([[Queensland Day]]).
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Memphis]] &ndash; [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] forces capture [[Memphis, Tennessee]], from the [[Confederate States of America|Confederates]].
*[[1882]] &ndash; More than 100,000 inhabitants of [[Bombay]] are killed when a [[cyclone]] in the [[Arabian Sea]] pushes huge waves into the harbour.
*  1882   &ndash; The [[Shewa]]n forces of [[Menelik II of Ethiopia]] defeat the [[Gojjam]]e army in the [[Battle of Embabo]]. The Shewans capture Negus Tekle Haymanot of Gojjam, and their victory leads to a Shewan hegemony over the territories south of the [[Abay River]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; The [[Great Seattle Fire]] destroys all of downtown Seattle.
*[[1892]] &ndash; The [[Chicago 'L'#History|Chicago 'L']] commuter rail system begins operation
*[[1894]] &ndash; [[Governor of Colorado|Governor]] [[Davis H. Waite]] orders the [[Colorado]] [[U.S. National Guard|state militia]] to protect and support the miners engaged in the [[Cripple Creek miners' strike of 1894|Cripple Creek miners' strike]].
*[[1909]] &ndash; French troops capture [[Abéché]] (in modern-day [[Chad]]) and install a puppet [[sultan]] in the [[Ouaddai Empire]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; The eruption of [[Novarupta]] in Alaska begins. It is the second largest [[volcanic]] eruption of the 20th century.
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Battle of Belleau Wood]] &ndash; The [[U.S. Marine Corps]] suffers its worst single day's casualties while attempting to recapture the wood at [[Château-Thierry]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; The [[Republic of Prekmurje]] ends.
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[Southwark Bridge]] in London is opened to traffic by King [[George V]] and [[Mary of Teck|Queen Mary]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; The [[Revenue Act of 1932]] is enacted, creating the first [[gas tax]] in the United States, at a rate of 1 cent per [[US gallon]] ({{1/4}}¢/L) sold.
*[[1933]] &ndash; The first [[drive-in theater]] opens, in [[Camden, New Jersey]], United States.
*[[1934]] &ndash; [[New Deal]]: the U.S. President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] signs the [[Securities Act of 1933]] into law, establishing the [[U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; Judge [[Joseph Force Crater]], known as the "Missingest Man in New York", is [[Declared death in absentia|declared legally dead]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Battle of Midway]]. U.S. Navy dive bombers sink the [[Japanese cruiser Mikuma]] and four Japanese carriers.
*[[1944]] &ndash;  World War II: the [[Normandy Landings|Battle of Normandy]] begins. [[D-Day]], code named ''[[Operation Overlord]]'', commences with the landing of 155,000 [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] troops on the beaches of [[Normandy]] in France. The allied soldiers quickly break through the [[Atlantic Wall]] and push inland in the largest amphibious military operation in history.
*[[1946]] &ndash; The [[National Basketball Association]] is created with eleven teams.
*[[1964]] &ndash; Under a temporary order, the [[Rocket experiments in the area of Cuxhaven|rocket launches at Cuxhaven]], Germany are terminated. They never resume.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Assassination of Robert F. Kennedy]]: [[Robert F. Kennedy]],  [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] senator from New York and brother of 35th President [[John F. Kennedy]], dies from gunshot wounds inflicted on June 5.
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Soyuz program]]: ''[[Soyuz 11]]'' is launched.
*  1971   &ndash; A [[Hughes Airwest Flight 706|midair collision]] between a [[Hughes Airwest]] [[Douglas DC-9]] [[Jet airliner|jetliner]] and a [[United States Marine Corps]] [[McDonnell Douglas]] [[F-4 Phantom II]] [[fighter aircraft|jet fighter]] near [[Duarte, California]], claims 50 lives.<!--Resulted in policy change; notable-->
*  1971   &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: the [[Battle of Long Khanh]] between [[Australian Army|Australian]] and [[People's Army of Vietnam|Vietnamese communist forces]] begins.
*[[1974]] &ndash; A new [[Instrument of Government (1974)|Instrument of Government]] is promulgated making Sweden a [[Parliamentarism|parliamentary]] monarchy.
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Bihar train disaster]]: a passenger train travelling between Mansi and [[Saharsa]], India, jumps the tracks at a bridge crossing the [[Bagmati|Bagmati river]]. The government places the official death toll at 268 plus another 300 missing; however, it is generally believed that the death toll is closer to 1,000.
*[[1982]] &ndash; The [[1982 Lebanon War]] begins. Forces under [[Israel]]i [[Defense Minister]] [[Ariel Sharon]] invade [[southern Lebanon]] during [[Operation Peace for the Galilee]], eventually reaching as far north as the capital [[Beirut]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; A [[Army Air Corps (United Kingdom)|British Army Air Corps]] [[Aérospatiale Gazelle|Gazelle]] helicopter is destroyed in [[1982 British Army Gazelle friendly fire incident|a friendly fire incident]], resulting in the loss of four lives.
*[[1984]] &ndash; ''[[Tetris]]'', one of the [[List of best-selling video games|best-selling video games]] of all time, is released.
*[[1985]] &ndash; The grave of "Wolfgang Gerhard" is opened in [[Embu]], [[Brazil]]; the exhumed remains are later proven to be those of [[Josef Mengele]], [[Auschwitz concentration camp|Auschwitz]]'s "Angel of Death". Mengele is thought to have drowned while swimming in February 1979.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The [[Fantoft Stave Church]] in Norway is destroyed by [[Varg Vikernes]]. This was the first in a string of church arsons in the [[Early Norwegian black metal scene]]
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Mongolia]] holds its first direct presidential [[election]]s.
*[[1997]] &ndash; Prom Mom incident: While attending her senior prom in [[Lacey Township, New Jersey]], [[Melissa Drexler]] gives birth in a bathroom stall, leaves the baby to die in a trash can and then returns to the prom.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[2002 Eastern Mediterranean event|Eastern Mediterranean event]]. A [[near-Earth asteroid]] estimated at ten meters in diameter explodes over the Mediterranean Sea between Greece and [[Libya]]. The resulting explosion is estimated to have a force of 26 [[kiloton]]s, slightly more powerful than the [[Nagasaki, Nagasaki|Nagasaki]] [[atomic bomb]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Tamil language|Tamil]] is established as a "[[Languages of India#Official classical languages|classical language]]" by the President of India, Dr. [[A. P. J. Abdul Kalam]], in a joint sitting of the two houses of the Indian Parliament.
*[[2005]] &ndash; In ''[[Gonzales v. Raich]]'', the [[United States Supreme Court]] upholds a federal law banning [[Cannabis (drug)|cannabis]], including [[medical marijuana]].
